column1: The '''Springle-ring''' was a dance of the [[Shire-hobbits]]. It was described as "a pretty dance
column2: but rather vigorous" where dancers leaped up often.<ref name=Party>{{FR|Party}}</ref>

column1: At the [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]] the dance was performed by [[Everard Took]] and [[Melilot Brandybuck]].<ref name=Party/> The dance is also mentioned in the [[Buckland]]ish poem ''[[Bombadil Goes Boating]]''
column2: witnessed by the daughters of [[Farmer Maggot]].<ref>{{AB|Boating}}</ref>

column1: The word ''[[Wiktionary:springle#English|springle]]'' has several meanings in English
column2: however [[Tolkien]] commented that the name is made-up
column3: ought to evoke the style of the dance.<ref>{{HM|N}}</ref>
